description: {"blocks":[{"key":"ci373","text":"DESS is a widely used storage solution to preserve DNA in biological tissue samples. DESS consists of 20% dimethyl sulfoxide (DMSO), 250 mM ethylenediaminetetraacetic acid (EDTA), and saturated sodium chloride (NaCl), and its efficacy has been confirmed in a variety of taxa and tissues. We introduce non-destructive DNA extraction and DNA barcoding using a portion of the DESS supernatant of a nematode specimen stored at room temperature for 10 years in DESS. This technique can also be used for the preservation and non-destructive DNA extraction of specimens of various species collected in the field. By immersing samples in DESS in the field to prevent DNA degradation, and then immersing them in new DESS in the laboratory after separation and identification to extract DNA from the supernatant, non-destructive DNA barcoding can be performed. Here, we provide full protocols on how to extract DNA from DESS solutions, and how to use the extracted DNA for DNA barcoding.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: Specimens,Non-destructive DNA extraction,DNA barcoding,nematode,animal,diatom,COI,18S,NGS,Nanopore,DESS,Sangar sequence,meiobenthos,preserve DNA and morphology

{"blocks":[{"key":"36dpg","text":"1.    DESS","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":6,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ltal","text":"1.1 Requirements for making DESS solution (ref: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ye_1FRIR8bY)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":44}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":48,"length":43}],"data":{}},{"key":"c26u5","text":"        Reagents
            ♦ Saturated sodium chloride (NaCl)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":8,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7lqif","text":"            ♦ 250mM EDTA (pH 8.0)            ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ejd2u","text":"            ♦ 20% DMSO                                  
            ♦ Deionized / Milli-Q water   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dkaa9","text":"        Equipment and disposables
            ♦ Measuring cylinder/volumetric flask
            ♦ Conical flask / Beaker
            ♦ Magnetic stirrer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":8,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1eoej","text":"1.2 DESS preparation and recipe","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":27}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6the4","text":"        Equipment and disposables","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":8,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"56be8","text":"                To prepare 1000 mL of DESS
            ♦ 500 mM EDTA (pH 8.0, 500 mL)
            ♦ DMSO (200 mL)
            ♦ NaCl (288 g)","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ff96","text":"Fill up to 1000 mL with sterile water.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dvajj","text":"Sterilize solutions by autoclaving for 20 min at 15 psi (1.05 kg/cm2) on a liquid cycle.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":67,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"af1d6","text":"Store the DESS solution at room temperature (10~25˚C).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dinll","text":"*Although NaCl may precipitate over time, this may not pose a problem; use the clear supernatant portion.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7r1gh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7vv5i","text":"2.    DNA extraction","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":6,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"163g","text":"1.2 Requirements for DNA extraction ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":32}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a43jh","text":"        Reagents","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":8,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5u1oh","text":"            ♦ Silica (FUJIFILM: wakosil [232-00841])
            ♦ 0.01 mol/L Hydrochloric acid
            ♦ AMpure (Beckman Coulter) or SeraPure (refer to the method described below for the preparation )
            ♦ Ethanol (99.5%)
            ♦ Ethanol (75%)
            ♦ 500 mM EDTA (pH 8.0)
            ♦ 1 M Tris-HCl (pH 8.0) 
            ♦ Distilled water 
            ♦ TE buffer (pH 8.0) 
            ♦ 0.1× TE buffer (pH 8.0) 
            ♦ Guanidine thiocyanate
            ♦ Triton X100
            ♦ Tween 20
            ♦ 500 mM Sodium acetate (pH 5.2)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"27jn6","text":"        Equipment and disposables
            ♦ Low DNA binding tube (e.g., Eppendorf LoBind tube, Cat.#0030108051) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":8,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1jkjm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4p4c4","text":"2.2 Preparation before DNA extraction ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":34}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"tv88","text":"       Silica solution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b28dl","text":"       To prepare 11 mL of silica solution
            ♦Wakosil (FUJIFILM [232-00841])    2.5 g
            ♦0.01 N HCl                                        11 mL","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6crsi","text":"             *Before starting the DNA extraction, aliquot 10 µL of the solution into new low-bind tubes.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9o2vo","text":" ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"df15m","text":"       SeraPure (Rohland et al. 2012)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e7oub","text":"       To prepare 50 mL of SeraPure
            ♦Sera-Mag SpeedBead Carboxylate-Modified [E3] Magnetic Particles      1 mL 
            ♦PEG8000                            9 g
            ♦NaCl                                    2.92 g
            ♦1 M Tris-HCl (pH 8.0)     500 μL 
            ♦500 mM EDTA (pH 8.0)  100 μL","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8nivl","text":"            ♦50-mL tube
            ♦1.5-mL tube ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5of8p","text":"       1.     Take 1 mL of well-mixed Sera-Mag SpeedBeads in a 1.5-mL tube by inverting the tube.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"q7r3","text":"       2.     Place the tube on a magnetic stand and wait for 5 min.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"da2bd","text":"       3.     Remove the supernatant with a pipette tip and discard it.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a9t9m","text":"       4.     Add 1 mL of TE buffer, remove the tube from the magnetic stand, and mix well by inverting.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"boel5","text":"       5.     Place the tube on the magnetic stand and wait for 5 min.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3qdg","text":"       6.     Remove the supernatant with a pipette tip and discard it.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"622sv","text":"       7.     Add 1 mL of TE buffer, remove the tube from the magnetic stand, and mix well by inverting.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6apru","text":"       8.    Place the tube on the magnetic stand and wait for 5 minutes.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4cr8u","text":"       9.     Remove the supernatant with a pipette tip and discard it.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6od88","text":"       10.    Add 1 mL of TE buffer, remove the tube from the magnetic stand, and mix well by inverting.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"da7nd","text":"       11.    In a 50-mL centrifuge tube, add 9 g of PEG8000 and 2.92 g of NaCl.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"21re3","text":"       12.    Add 500 μL of 1 M Tris-HCl (pH 8.0) and 100 μL of 500 mM EDTA (pH 8.0).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5l1pn","text":"       13.    Fill up to 45 mL with sterile distilled water and completely dissolve the PEG.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b8cf5","text":"       14.    Add 27.5 μL of Tween-20 and 1 mL of the solution from step 10.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ajdr","text":"       15.    Fill up to 50 mL with sterile distilled water.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1qt9t","text":" ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fscjd","text":"       Binding Buffer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f52li","text":"       To prepare 120 mL of binding buffer 
            ♦Guanidine thiocyanate                           70.9 g
            ♦Triton X100                                               4.8 g 
            ♦Tween 20                                                 12 %
            ♦500 mM Sodium acetate (pH 5.2)       240 μL","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aggjd","text":"*If preparing this buffer is difficult, try using Buffer AL (QIAGEN, Cat. No.19075) as an alternative.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a7q92","text":" ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e26lr","text":"       Wash Buffer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"25pda","text":"       Stock wash buffer:ethanol = 1:4 ratio. (e.g., 20 mL stock wash buffer + 80 mL ethanol)","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cgjeu","text":"       Toprepare 50 mL of Stock wash buffer
            ♦500 mM EDTA (pH 8.0)      50 μL
            ♦5 M NaCl                               1 mL
            ♦1 M Tris-HCl (pH 8.0)       100 μL","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"coimk","text":" ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fddfc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4g6um","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e5d5h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9nkvc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cioao","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"adhmo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"68scr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a0tqs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aqho4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"g5ru","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"13jvn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4i02u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ev3h7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"48q8o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"C8AD5B64C18111EE85210A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ye_1FRIR8bY"}}}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5ag5v","text":"Sample storage using DESS solution (see Materials page)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":55}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"elpel","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d7aff","text":"To transport or store the DNA as undamaged as possible, place the specimen or environmental sample in DESS solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8pknt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a0vfd","text":"*Cautions when the sample is an animal","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cvmc6","text":"Since the DESS solution has low toxicity, animals are not immediately killed when placed in the DESS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c0gf0","text":"It is advisable to kill it somehow before putting the animals into the DESS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1kvdn","text":"This treatment is not particularly necessary for microscopic specimens (e.g. meiofauna).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3obp1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4iace","text":"Samples in DESS should be stored in the dark at room temperature (10 ~ 35゜C)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
